listForest

listForest provides for lists of forests. [19.3 Another Tree Notation ]
Modulenets â€” Graphs, networks, and trees

    Note

    One or more forests representing the same object.

    Example
    <listForest> <forest type="derivation-syntactic"> <tree ord="true"> <root children="#fgex1 #fgex2"/> <!-- ... --> </tree> <!-- ... --> </forest> <forest type="derivation-prosodic"> <tree ord="true"> <root children="#fgex3 #fgex4"/> <!-- ... --> </tree> <!-- ... --> </forest> </listForest>
    Content model<content> <sequence> <elementRef key="desc" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="forest" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </content>
